intro: Cyrtandra platyphylla var. stylopubens, commonly known as the broad-leaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its broad, oval-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are often visited by native bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
